greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Permutation of natural numbers: a(1) = 1, a(2n) = 1 + A003961(a(n)), a(2n+1) = A003961(1+a(n)). [Where A003961(n) shifts the prime factorization of n one step left].
comment: The even bisection halved gives A245608. The odd bisection incremented by one and halved gives A245708.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10001
Index entries for sequences that are permutations of the natural numbers
formula: As a composition of related permutations:
program: A003961(n) = my(f = factor(n)); for (i=1, #f~, f[i, 1] = nextprime(f[i, 1]+1)); factorback(f); \\ This function from _Michel Marcus_
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Jul 29 2014
